Reviews.Content: The staff were kind and friendly, though as others have pointed out their English wasn't great. But, in our experience, that didn't keep them from trying to make conversation. The hotel was fine, the room nice, and the breakfast buffet all right. Given the price, however, I had higher expectations. That aside, the one major issue that we had was that their recommendations were not that good. When we asked that a taxi be called, we were picked up by a cab who happened to be a friend of one of the very kind staff. The cab driver, however, was not as gracious. After starting to drive (in a big rain storm) we were told that he would only be able to drive us part of the way, leaving us with the impression that he "couldn't" reach our final destination and that we would only be outside in the rain for a brief period. The truth is that he *could* have driven door-to-door (it was possible) but instead told us to get out of the car in the middle of the freeway exit when he assured us that we were very close. We were not that close...after 20 minutes of searching in the pouring rain, we were soaked for our nice dinner out. The following morning we took the Bosphorus Cruise that the hotel recommended, only to find the entire trip poorly organized. Frankly it was a ripoff. In a lot of places they say that the hotel makes the best recommendations. In this case, the hotel was fine, but its recommendations were not.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard hotel in a prime location but beware of "overbooking"”
Reviews.Author: MikeG95
Reviews.Content: Our first impressions of the Gulhane Hotel was certainly not the best. We arrived after midnight (the hotel was informed of our late arrival) but were told that there were not rooms available, so ended up having to stay in another hotel across the road. It appears that this was not an isolated mistake and other travellers have had the same experience. This is a pity as the hotel itself is very comfortable and in an excellent location, close to the all the main historic sites in Sultanhamet and the bustling area around Sirkeci Station. The breakfast was adequate although do not expect a luxurious hot buffet. Sausage and chips seemed to be the main fare most days. The staff were generally very service minded. In summary however, the rating has suffered due to this overbooking "problem", which signifies that I would stay in a different hotel next time. Istanbul itself, is an amazing city

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel possible not 4*, english 2*”
Reviews.Author: maz176
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying in this hotel and it is the worst stay I have ever had in a hotel. Ity does not have 4* standards at all. I had booked a turkish bath only to find I had to bathe myself, with water in a marble room. The breakfast was boiled eggs with bread and chips. we ordered orange juice for whichy we got charged Â£3.00 each, Orage juice was freshly squeezed but we werent told it was chrgeable. Also we ordererd an omlette but this time we thought to ask is it free and she said we had to pay depending on ingredients. The staff don't go out of their way to help, its hit or miss some will help, others will ignore your call and pretend that you didnt call. The hotel smells of stale smoke all the time. They will not clean your room whilst you're there, even if you request it. Positive point, central to attraction points I can truly and honestly stay this is the worst hotel ive ever been to, bare in mind I have stayed in a two star in Egypt and even taht was slightly better. This is a two star by their local standard not international standard.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly place”
Reviews.Author: flamengoriodejaneiro
Reviews.Content: Gulhane park hotel itÂ´s a good place to stay, comfortable, clean and large rooms. ItÂ´s located close to everything that worth to visit in Istanbul. Staff are very kindly, specially a girl named Yagmur (means rain in turkey), that explain the best places to visit and to shopping. Marcio Tenenbaum Rio de Janeiro, Brasil

Reviews.Title: “Very central location, clean and functional with extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mooney123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated down a sidestreet so it was was very quiet but if it is views you want this hotel is not for you. However, it is right in the heart of the city and we were just walking distance from many of the major tourist attractions. The hotel reception, dining room and bedrooms are extremely clean and functional although a tiny bit bland. There was an excellent choice for breakfast and it was well presented and free internet was easily accessible. The big plus was the friendliness of the hotel staff. They could not be more helpful and nothing was too much trouble. My 5 year old son had great fun and was sad to leave them! I would definitely stay here again. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Istanbul? Not a Princess? Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: 21stcenturytravel
Reviews.Content: POSITIVE POINTS: If you've never been to Turkey or to Istanbul, GÃ¼lhane Park Hotel is a great place to base your trip because of the location and the staff helpfulness. First of all, you couldn't ask for a better spot in the not-as-touristy section of the tourist district. You're within a five minute walk (ten if you're slow and have trouble with hills) from the Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque, and just around the corner from the Topkapi Palace. Sirkeci train station is around the other corner, and the little side-street behind the hotel opens up right onto the GÃ¼lhane tram stop, which will take you most places. GÃ¼lhane Park Hotel is not on the main road, so you don't get the noise from the street traffic, and yet isn't hard to find as it's not very far into the side-street maze behind the station. You'll find the staff are very acquainted with tourists of all kinds, so if this is your first time in Istanbul - or even your first time abroad - the staff will answer even the silliest of questions and help you do things as simple as make dinner reservations, or call a museum to find the opening hours. The staff are a very small group of about six front-desk personnel, two dining staff, and three cleaning staff (as far as we could tell). The staff are all excellent English speakers, helpful, polite and pleasant, though sometimes we felt that the cleaning staff were particularly displeased when we put up a do-not-disturb sign before going down to breakfast. They seemed quite determined to get all the rooms clean by noon, and we preferred to eat first then get ready to go out. They knock on the doors before coming in, but if you're in the shower after breakfast you might want to let them know. The front desk is always attended. Don't be shy with putting money in the tip-box on the front-desk counter, with someone watching, so as to let the staff know how much you appreciate them. We gave a grand total of about 70YTL in tips at the end of our 10-day trip, though we wonder if perhaps one fellow at the front desk would have been a little more pleased to see us if we'd have tipped him earlier in the trip for helping us with bags and getting settled in. Breakfast is a simple but sufficient affair, with a NescafÃ© machine putting out palatable instant coffee (with or without milk) and hot water for plain black tea in bags. The breakfast is mostly the same day-to-day, from 7:30-10:30, and after ten mornings we became aficionados of olive paste and a small range of Turkish cheeses. The yogurt is delicious. The bread is better untoasted. We couldn't identify what the sausage was made of. Every morning everything will be fresh but teh same selection, except maybe a dish or two that's unlike the ones the day before. The breakfast room can get crowded in the later hour of about 9-9:30. We did not eat at the restaurant for other meals, and did not try room service. There's no point - Istanbul has plenty of great food to be had wherever you go, so why stay in the hotel? Very nearby are some good places to get a quick meal or a late meal (Faros Restaurant on the other side of the tram tracks just off the corner of the little street leading to GPHotel is a good place to get some good non-Turkish food and has a kitchen open very late). Generally, the hotel is on the spartan side, with no-frills rooms that are clean and simple, without very many amenities. Nice pillows and warm blankets, though. We traveled in February so we're not sure how sufficient the air conditioning is, but it was warm and cozy through the cold late-winter weeks. (Bring an umbrella if you plan on visiting between January and April.) There is a safe in the closet, which we used, but at no point did we feel unsafe about leaving a computer or camera or cellphones lying about the room when we were gone. NOT SO POSITIVE POINTS: If you are accustomed to a certain level of luxury or have a refined sense of design you will not immediately see the charm of this tiny, beige-and-olive-green hotel. The rooms are very small, and the bed takes up most of the space. The bed is large enough, but can be on the lumpy side. The pillows are plentiful but a little too puffy. The bathroom is clean and well lit but the shower is TINY, and it's hard to turn or move without bumping something. The water is nice and hot, though. The shampoo and bath soaps are not great quality, and they don't necessarily get replenished often. The water is not potable (according to the sign above the sink) but it isn't too foul to brush your teeth with. It is quite chalky. The hotel leaves a bottle of water free of charge on the first day, but does not continue to do so every day. Be prepared to buy at least 1 liter of water (1-2YTL's worth) per day. The hot water boiler is small, and the tea and coffee packets are also not replenished once you've used them. There is only one room that actually overlooks the park, and if you don't have that one, you'll be looking at the carpark. If you MUST have a good view, don't stay at this hotel. If you're not a blob who stays in the hotel all the time you won't care about the ducks on the roof across the carpark or the lack of any greenery because all you really need to do in the hotel is sleep and shower. The good views in Istanbul are plentiful outside the hotel. There is, however, a very good chance of noise from the carpark at night, such as car alarms, passers-by talking loudly, police sirens, angry ducks, angry cats and the like. If you are given a room near the elevator don't be surprised to hear the awful elevator music through the hall and your door. It is quite loud. Also foot traffic and people talking in the hallways is audible from rooms by the staircase and elevator. We did not try the "hamam" or the gym, downstairs, but from what we gathered the hotel wasn't particularly proud of them. They are not free of charge. The bar is not worth trying, what with a whole new city to explore right outside. Often there is the smell of cigarette smoke in the downstairs lobby late at night, which comes from the one bar patron who may be someone at the hotel's cousin or brother. IN CONCLUSION: if you're looking for a budget hotel with all the basics covered in a nice location and with English-speaking staff, but are not expecting the Ritz, then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience at Gulhane Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelmateMumbai
Reviews.Content: From Alwyn and Lana Dsouza, India We have just returned from a trip to istanbul and ,stayed for 4 nights at the Gulhane Park Hotel. We found the staff very helpful and eager to make our stay a comfortable one. Soner Onal and Erol deserve special mention for their readiness to assist even during odd hours of the day. The Hotel itself is very well located ,close to the Sultanahmet area and within a 7- 10 minute walk from the major attractions like the Blue Mosque, Ayasofya , Topkapi Palace and Bascilica Cistern. Another advantage is the hotel's proximity to the tram station (Gulhane Park tram station is just 200 metres away) from where one can travel (within a cost of TL 1.50 i.e.~ US$ 1.50 per person,oneway), towards Kabatasand the waterfront area for cruises on the Bosphorus or Princes Island in the Marmara Sea. The rooms were decently sized, similar to other European boutique hotels.. sufficient for a couple, but probably crowded for a fgroup of three or more people. The bathrooms however are tiny. The complimentary breakfast included sufficient number of items to satisfy most guests. All in all a very satisfying experience, and we would definitely recommend this hotel to future visitors to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I had a nice stay in Istanbul at Gulhane Park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peralaperala
Reviews.Content: After falling in a trap travestied as a four-star hotel in Istanbul (booked via internet), I decided to take a friend's advice and, after visiting Gulhane Park Hotel and getting acquainted with its accommodations, I immediately moved to it with my family. This hotel is cozy, clean and silent, with amenities such as fitness centre, sauna and bars. Its staff is always ready to help you day or night, especially Miss TugÃ§e, which is even capable of speaking some Portuguese just to make you feel at home. Gulhane Park Hotel location is the best, in my opinion, surrounded with restaurants and at foot-walking distance from the main attractions at that corner of the city. For sure I will use this hotel again the next time I visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money - location excellent for local attractions”
Reviews.Author: HaVePhotography
Reviews.Content: Searched a long time for suitable hotel for our weekend in Istanbul; decided eventually to plump for something cheaper (we paid a total of Â£128 via lastminute.com for 3 nights B&B), but within walking distance to the mosque/ayia sophia and the bazaars. The location is excellent, tram stop very close, a great bar one street up, plenty of restaurants in the area if you don't feel like a trek. Hotel staff are very kind and attentive, thank you to Erol and Tugce especially. The rooms are small (we decided they were 'cosy') but clean and all the usual amenities. Breakfast was ok, but don't expect 5* dining, coffee and eggs, bread and pastries were all fine and filling. There is no view to speak of - apart from the car park - but I'm sure in the summer months, the roof area would offer a view should that be a priority. (closed when we went). We made use of the bar twice, but no-one else seemed to frequent it, making it a bit flat. I would recommend this hotel if you want to experience Istanbul without spending a fortune. I would not recommend the massage service, it is not worth the money, not very professional and although my husband and I booked different massages, his costing 10 euros more, they were identical. I had bruises on my back and did not enjoy the experience. As someone who teaches massage, I am in a position to comment on this - take note! A final piece of advice - we were ripped off by a taxi driver, he took a 20 lira note and then handed the note back saying it was ripped (it was, but it wasn' t the note we had handed over) then tried to get another 5 lira through confusion in giving change. We ended up with the ripped note which no-one wanted. The journey bback to the hotel cost a third of the outward journey. Also watch out for the shoe-shine guys who drop their brush as they pass you - it's in your good nature to pick it up and run after them, they then 'give' you a shoe-shine, in thanks for doing a good deed then demand cash!! Overall Istanbul is a great city and we really loved the people. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: itinerant123456
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, comfortable rooms and delicious food. The hotel and the staff make you feel very welcome. It has been an amazing experience. Thanks to mr.Sonar Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “room noÄ±sy and dusty hammam not for free”
Reviews.Author: afnaafna
Reviews.Content: I have been Ä±n thÄ±s hotel for 8 nÄ±ghts cause Ä± ve booked for so long cause the good ratÄ±ngs on Ä±nternet. Our room was so dusty that Ä± got cold for an allergy. The room Ä±s been absolutely noÄ±sy durÄ±ng the nÄ±ght cause the aÄ±r condÄ±tÄ±oner and the bathroom dÄ±dnt smell good. The maÄ±n door of the hotel has been not workÄ±ng for all the 8 days!!!!! What can Ä± add? They charged us 30 euros for goÄ±ng Ä±n theÄ±r poor cold and not so clean hammam even Ä±n the sÄ±te Ä±t s not specÄ±fÄ±ed that Ä±t s not for free.... Poor Poor Hotel.. I would prefer a 2 stars hotel where Ä± can sleep Ä±n relax and not havÄ±ng allergy cause the dust on the room.....

Reviews.Title: “Very close to all the attractions”
Reviews.Author: W0man
Reviews.Content: Very close to Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque, as well as historical Istanbul. Staff were nice (which was a first, and a very welcomed improvement), everything seemed a lot more civilised and advanced in Istanbul. Loved the room, and for some reason loved the view from the room - although it was onto a carpark and some random back street shops, I guess I was just in love with Istanbul from the get go. When we arrived they were very accomodating, and their cards with basic Turkish language was very helpful. The shower leaked, which was problematic, so we needed to ask for extra towels. Breakfast wasn't grand but was okay, and the waiters were just so friendly! (in a genuine, nice way). One man at the reception couldn't understand my Australian accent but that was about it, their English was very good otherwise. Loved watching all the channels they had on TV!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best.”
Reviews.Author: laperche
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous. To begin with, there is a spa in the hotel that offers a full range of spa treatments, including Turkish baths. The hotel is located within a 5 minute walk of Hagia Sophia. The rooms were well appointed, clean, airy, and full of light. This is just a lovely hotel with a fabulous staff. I will always stay here when I travel to Istanbul. (The breakfasts were wonderful as well. There is also high speed internet.) Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't ask for a better experience”
Reviews.Author: AA97531
Reviews.Content: We had the most pleasant surprise staying in this hotel. The hotel's location, staff and service made our first trip to Istanbul a wonderful vacation. The hotel location is not far from the airport and within walking distance to Hagia Sophia, The Blue Mosque, both The Grand Bazaar and The Egyptian Bazaar, in addition to many stores and mosques. Each day after a wonderful open buffet breakfast in the hotel, we were able to walk to any of these sites and other tourist areas, including the hamams. The hotel staff was very courteous, attentive, and extremely polite and helpful. They went above and beyond expectation when they prepared a wonderful breakfast for us before 5 am, 2.5 hours ahead of the regular breakfast hour. The hotel is located in a quiet area. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and well-maintained. We will definitely stay there again during our next trip, which we hope soon.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, perfect location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: alexander_ko
Reviews.Content: i stayed in gulhane park this year, for more then 3 month during my business trip in turkey. the hotel is perfect for business matters in the same time it gives you a warm family home feeling. the location is perfect. 150 m to the tramway, busstation or harbour, where you can reach all destinations in istanbul. if you do not want to take them, a taxi always wait you close to the hotel. the hotel is located closed to the gÃ¼lhanepark, a very nice and silent place, where you can relax from istanbul life. or if you are a runner, you can do your run their and along the coast, do your daily workout in the hotel fitnesscenter. the hotel is 250 m away from the most important sight seeing places like blue mosc, haghia sophia and 400 m away from grand basar. to the great yeni camii (mosc) its only 250 m. the rooms are clean, the staff very friendly, kind and helpfull, agreat view from the hotel terasse. the breakfast covers all your wishes and the hotel manager is a great men. i can not wait to be back "home" in gulhanepark. thx to all. alexander

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: hunter055
Reviews.Content: Location is great, view to Bosphor, nice and clean room, nice food, excellent service!!!

Reviews.Title: “I had vacations thanks to the Gulhane Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glauberlapis
Reviews.Content: I went to Turkey and I had no place to stay yet. Fortunately I found the Gulhane park Hotel and I could find what a traveler like me needs. Good food, good bed and an excellent service!! I had moments that I prefer to stay at the hotel then left to go around. So confortable!! If you want some cool place to stay, go to this place, you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “''hunky dory'' pleasant stay & unprecedented service”
Reviews.Author: loveYOUalot
Reviews.Content: From our arrival on September 13th to our departure on the 19th, The Hotel members did so much to welcome us and assure our comfort as guests. An easy and smooth check-in is vital for those whoâ€™ve traveled hundreds of miles , and they were on hand to accomplish that with efficiency and grace. The warm personal greetings for our entire travel group set the right tone for the rest of our stay, and Iâ€™m much in your debt for the extra courtesies that helped me relax and enjoy the trip even while I was the tour leader. The small gathering you arranged for us on our final night was a hit with everyone, and you have many new advocates and preservation friends in our part of the country. I congratulate you on a job superbly performed and thank you for creating our new impression of Turkish hospitality. I wish you all expanding success as you continue the traditions of serving your community and the traveling public. Your area has incredible resources beyond the better-known witch attractions, and I await my next return with happy anticipation. Gulhane has an exciting future, and I know the Gulhane Park Hotel will always be a part of it. Your building deserves to shine and be proud forever. Surely it will do so in your care. Most sincerely yours,

Reviews.Title: “Fair stay”
Reviews.Author: Excellent_choice
Reviews.Content: The hotel localization was great with nice and clean room. Several small problems with wireless connection and air conditioning function but a lot due to bad know-how from the staff. They are very nice and proative people but not very capable to fix simple problems (mainly in night shifts). The hotel is in very good conditions and clean.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at this well-located, well staffed boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Alisandra48
Reviews.Content: The Gulhane Park Hotel combines the best of opposites: it has the elegance, service and ammenities of a grand hotel, but the accessible coziness of a small boutique. The wonderful parkside location is quiet - away from the bustling markets, yet just a couple of short blocks walk to the lively streets. No matter where we wandered, we could always home in on the Bosphorus and Topkapi to find our way "home." At first, we were dissappointed that breakfast was not on the roof terrace, but we soon realised the greater wisdom of placing the bountiful buffet location off the lobby - out of the sun and away from the birds. We still enjoyed the marvelous view and the Mosque soundscape from the rooftop at dawn and dusk. The staff was lovely - helpful with directions and patient with our requests for pronunciation of our very few Turkish words. My only dissatisfaction was with the 'spa.' They have made a very clever use of space downstairs for a workout room, hammam and spa facility. The services are possibly quite nice for most people, but I had one of the worst massage experiences of my life. At first I thought it was simply a style difference, as I have heard Turkish massage referred to as 'a pummeling.' But it has been 5 days, and the nasty bruises on my inner thighs are just now fading. I was actually afraid when the masseur laid his forearm across the front of my throat and leaned. I pushed him off, but should have stopped the massage right there. It is a testament to how nice the desk staff and management are that I didn't want to cause a hassle. We wish the best of success to this hotel and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: hooliganhooker
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the hotel after a long night of travel we were a little worried about since it appeared to be in a pretty run down area. Upon entry the staff was very friendly as they tried out their English on us. The hotel is very modern and from the terrace on the roof you could see the park which was just across the street and also see across to the Bosporus. There is a small bar which was tended by the front desk staff and a dining area where the breakfast was served. Wireless internet was provided free of charge. The best feature though was the location. We were within easy walking distance of all of the major destinations in the Sultanahmet, including the Topkapi Palace, Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar. Also was very convenient to the tram and many excellent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great holiday”
Reviews.Author: kiti1
Reviews.Content: The hotel Gulhane Park is very clean and elegant. it is a small hotel but the location is wonderful. The rooms are clean and elegant. The breakfast is not very diversify but it was enough. The principales objectives are near the hotel around 200 meters or more less.
